body: @xuzhao9 How does `KDE` pickup icons for the task switcher? Does it use `NET_WM_ICON` or it just query them from `/usr/share/pixmaps` ? I guess the first one, since you've mentioned `extra/windows/alacritty.ico`, which is used for `NET_WM_ICON`, but I remember that it uses `/usr/share/pixmaps` over `NET_WM_ICON` in some places, so just wondering what you've changed here.
@kchibisov Yes, it uses the NET_WM_ICON. /usr/share/pixmaps/Alacritty.svg is the vector one therefore should not be blurred, however it is not being used.

Since the .ico is primarily for the standard Windows icon, it's probably a good idea to check how it looks on Windows. As far as I remember, there were some good reasons for building the ico the way it has been built, however it's possible that just increasing the resolution would still work fine on Windows.
@xuzhao9 Yes, seems like that, unfortunately we can't use `svg` for `NET_WM_ICON`, since our dependency doesn't support loading them (`KDE`/`Qt` had some problems with `Alacritty.svg` though).

@chrisduerr As far as I've [understood](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/uxguide/vis-icons) we can use icon with `256x256` for windows (The maximum size for `ico`). It will downscale it to appropriate size.

@xuzhao9 How did you build this icon though? Upscale?

Well we do provide the SVGs, so rendering them to a specific size as a PNG shouldn't be too difficult and that's what I've done to create the icons myself. I think the icon might contain multiple images at multiple sizes though, or at least some dynamic properties. However I'm unsure how well Windows supports this. Ideally we'd want to use the image with scanlines for 256x256 size icons, however it wouldn't look good when scaled to a smaller size.
@kchibisov I built this icon from the svg file with imagemagick.

> Well we do provide the SVGs, so rendering them to a specific size as a PNG shouldn't be too difficult and that's what I've done to create the icons myself. 

Yes, I've also thought about this myself. I've  asked @xuzhao9 , since the corners of his new image are choppy. On a page I've linked there is a section `Size requirements`, windows supports sets of icons. So we can include `16x16`, `32x32`, `48x48`, and `256x256` ( as advertised ), I wonder how `X11` would behave though.

>  @kchibisov I built this icon from the svg file with imagemagick.

Hm, maybe some tuning required here.

I remember that there was some kind of issue with the combination of imagemagick and Icon sets on Windows. I just don't remember what exactly was the problem, but the dynamic sizing did not work properly iirc.

>  I just don't remember what exactly was the problem, but the dynamic sizing did not work properly iirc.

That's sad. So, maybe creating the icon set on windows directly ( with some tools from microsoft or something like that)  and after that testing on linux + X11? 

-- A little bit off
@chrisduerr , Do you know if it's possible to run `alacritty` inside windows vm ( virtual box ) or native environment required here?

I have not been able to run Windows on my proxmox VM yet, because of missing OpenGL functionality/drivers. However on Linux things worked just fine even virtualized. I haven't looked into this a lot and I'd welcome potential solutions for myself, but I would be surprised if it just works out of the box for you.
